intro: Atriplex glauca subsp. mauritanica, commonly known as the Mauritania saltbush, is a shrub native to arid and semi-arid regions of North Africa and the Middle East. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating to reduce water loss. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in clusters, typically during the spring and early summer. It is well adapted to saline and alkaline soils, making it a common species in desert environments. Its ability to thrive in harsh conditions makes it an important plant for stabilizing soil and preventing erosion in arid landscapes.
